en: After leading the people out of Egypt, God speaks to them at the mountain.
Through Moses, He gives commands that shape their worship and their way of life.

lines: I am the Lord your God.
You shall have no other gods before me.
You shall not make for yourself an idol
in the form of anything in heaven above
or on the earth beneath
or in the waters below.
You shall not misuse the name of the Lord your God,
for the Lord will not hold anyone guiltless
who misuses his name.
Remember the Sabbath day by keeping it holy.
Honor your father and your mother,
so that you may live long in the land
the Lord your God is giving you.
You shall not murder.
You shall not commit adultery.
You shall not steal.
You shall not give false testimony against your neighbour.
You shall not covet your neighbour’s house.
You shall not covet your neighbour’s wife,
or his servant,
or his ox or donkey,
or anything that belongs to your neighbour.
Hear, O Israel:
The Lord our God, the Lord is one.
Love the Lord your God
with all your heart
and with all your soul
and with all your strength.

question.en: What do these commands show about who God is—and how people are meant to live before Him and with one another?
